chunks.en: Is the Jingdong subsidy price of 7999 for the MacBook Air M3 13-inch 512+24 worth buying?
I'm currently still using a MacBook Pro 2018 15-inch 512+16.
When traveling, I use LR to edit photos. I feel like bringing an Air would be lighter. I generally only process photos and don't edit videos.
The existing MBP sometimes lags a bit when using LR, and the fan makes a whirring sound.
I might deploy a model locally, like Qwen, to help with coding. I might also run a local K8s cluster to play with toy projects.

chunks.en: The existing MBP struggles to run K8s, but I feel the main issue is Docker. Running a local model is even more challenging.

chunks.en: I'm not sure if the M3 Air has enough performance. Should I wait for the M4 Air?
@boubuo The warranty is valid at both authorized and direct stores.
I missed the good timing. I bought the same configuration 15-inch for 12,000.
If you go to an offline authorized store, you can use the national subsidy, which will likely be cheaper than this.
This one is 7199, why spend 7999?
Offline channels offer it for 7199. I suggest checking with an offline authorized store.
Wait for M4.
@longzhou6431 Are you referring to offline Apple authorized stores, not direct stores?
Damn, I bought a 16+256 in Vietnam last October and still spent over 9000.
@willygeek007 I've never bought from an authorized store. Can I still get the warranty service at an Apple direct store?
I'm also waiting and seeing. I'll wait for the M4 in case there's a surprise.
It's not worth spending an extra 800 yuan.
JD offline is 7199.
This configuration is now 7199. Don't waste your money.
I bought the 128GB version and it works great with a NAS.
I asked several stores in Guangzhou about the 7199 price, and they all said the promotion is over. I don't know if there are any around.
It's not worth it because those needs aren't essential. If you couldn't stand it, you would have replaced it long ago. Wait a bit longer.
